sentences.en: For we repudiate war and violence.
sentences.cn: 因为我们唾弃战争和暴力.

sentences.en: He repudiated all offers of friendship.
sentences.cn: 他拒绝任何人给他的友谊。

sentences.en: He used his position to repudiate the charge.
sentences.cn: 他利用自己的职位来否认指控.

sentences.en: He will indignantly repudiate the suggestion.
sentences.cn: 他会气愤地拒绝接受这一意见.

sentences.en: However, the Citizens opinion does not necessarily repudiate that proposition.
sentences.cn: 但不管怎样, "公民"案的意见未必就否认了这一主张.

sentences.en: I won't repudiate my debts , why are you forcing me to pay so strongly?
sentences.cn: 我又不会赖账,你何必苦苦索逼?

sentences.en: Leaders urged people to turn out in large numbers to repudiate the violence.
sentences.cn: 领导们力劝人们集体出面反对暴力。

sentences.en: MacDiarmid wanted to repudiate his lyrical quality.
sentences.cn: 麦克迪阿来德想要放弃他的抒情格调.

sentences.en: Of cause storms do cause problems, but one should not repudiate them.
sentences.cn: 当然风暴也有风暴的弊端, 但无论怎样不能全盘否定.

sentences.en: We must firmly repudiate these wrong ideas and check their spread.
sentences.cn: 我们一定要彻底批判这些错误思想,绝对不能让它们流行.

sentences.en: WORD OF THE DAY - repudiate : to reject ; to deny. The gangsters repudiated all accusations of unlawful activity.
sentences.cn: 否认,否定; 驳斥,批驳这些帮派份子,否认他们被起诉的不法勾当.

words.tran_cn: 否认，拒绝；抛弃，断绝关系

trans.tran_cn: 拒绝；否定；批判；与…断绝关系；拒付
trans.tran_en: to refuse to accept or continue with something

trans.tran_cn: （正式地）否认，拒绝接受，拒绝与…往来，拒不履行（法律义务）
